modules.description: Provides asynchronous I/O operations such as reading from and writing to file descriptors, handling network connections, and managing timeouts. Works with Lwt-based promises ('a Lwt.t), IP addresses (inet_addr), and configuration parameters (unit). Used for building non-blocking network servers and handling concurrent I/O tasks efficiently.

Provides asynchronous and blocking socket operations for establishing and managing IRC connections. Works with socket descriptors, message parsing, and event-driven communication. Used to implement real-time chat clients with support for both non-blocking I/O and traditional blocking workflows.

Handles asynchronous I/O with Lwt, enabling non-blocking network communication through file descriptors, IP addresses, and timeout management. Supports concurrent operations like reading, writing, and connection handling using promises. Tasks such as managing TCP streams or scheduling delayed actions are executed efficiently. Example uses include building real-time chat clients or scalable network services.
